Interface FlexiblePortfolioModelInterface

All Superinterfaces:
ModelInterface
All Known Implementing Classes:
FlexiblePortfolioModel
public interface FlexiblePortfolioModelInterface extends ModelInterface
The interface for the model. Is able to create a portfolio given ticker names and stock amounts, create a portfolio from a file, save a portfolio to file, and determine the value of a portfolio on a given date.

  • Method Details

    • createPortfolio

      void createPortfolio​(String portfolioName, String[] tickerSymbols, float[] stockAmounts)
      Creates a portfolio with the given name from the given stocks and number of each stock.
      Specified by:
      createPortfolio in interface ModelInterface
      Parameters:
      portfolioName - the name of the portfolio to be created.
      tickerSymbols - a String array of ticker symbols.
      stockAmounts - in the order of the stocks specified in tickerSymbols, says how many of each stock to add to the portfolio.

    • createPortfolioFromFile

      void createPortfolioFromFile​(String portfolioName, String filename)
      Creates a portfolio using the data from a file. The format of the file should be the same as a file created by the savePortfolioToFile method.
      Specified by:
      createPortfolioFromFile in interface ModelInterface
      Parameters:
      portfolioName - how the portfolio will be named
      filename - the file to read the portfolio data from

    • savePortfolioToFile

      void savePortfolioToFile​(String portfolioName, String filename)
      Saves one of the users portfolios to a file containing the portfolio name and stock composition.
      Specified by:
      savePortfolioToFile in interface ModelInterface
      Parameters:
      portfolioName - the portfolio to write to file
      filename - the name of the output file, exactly as given

    • determineValue

      float determineValue​(String portfolioName, String date)
      Calculates the total value of a portfolio on the given date.
      Specified by:
      determineValue in interface ModelInterface
      Parameters:
      portfolioName - the portfolio to find the value of
      date - in MM/DD/YYYY format
      Returns:
      the value of the portfolio

    • stockDirection

      boolean stockDirection​(String tickerSymbol, String date) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Determines whether the given stock gained or lost on the given day.
      Specified by:
      stockDirection in interface ModelInterface
      Parameters:
      tickerSymbol - the stock to check
      date - the date to check the stock data for
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if the stock gained, false if it lost value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if given an invalid ticker symbol

    • stockDirection

      boolean stockDirection​(String tickerSymbol, String startDate, String endDate) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Determines whether the given stock gained or lost over the given period of time, from start_date to end_date (both in MM/DD/YYYY). Uses closing values.
      Specified by:
      stockDirection in interface ModelInterface
      Parameters:
      tickerSymbol - the stock to check
      startDate - the start of the period to check
      endDate - the end of the period to check
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if the stock gained, false if it lost value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if given an invalid ticker symbol

    • movingAverage

      float movingAverage​(int numDays, String tickerSymbol, String date) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Calculates the average price for the given stock in the last x days, starting from the given date. It includes the last x days for which stock prices are available.
      Parameters:
      numDays - x in the x-day moving average
      tickerSymbol - the stock to calculate the average for
      date - the last date of the desired period, in MM/DD/YYYY
      Returns:
      the average stock price of the given period
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if given an invalid ticker symbol

    • findCrossovers

      String findCrossovers​(String tickerSymbol, String startDate, String endDate) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a list of the positive crossovers and negative crossovers within the given time period.
      Parameters:
      tickerSymbol - the stock to check for crossovers
      startDate - the start date of the period to check (in MM/DD/YYYY format)
      endDate - the end date of the period to check (in MM/DD/YYYY format)
      Returns:
      a string listing the positive and negative crossovers. For the View to parse into the final printed output.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if given an invalid ticker symbol

    • findMovingCrossovers

      String findMovingCrossovers​(String tickerSymbol, String startDate, String endDate, int x, int y) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a list of the positive crossovers and negative crossovers within the given time period. A moving crossover happens when an x-day moving average crosses from one side to another side of a y-day moving average, with x lesser than y.
      Parameters:
      tickerSymbol - the stock to check for crossovers
      startDate - the start date of the period to check (in MM/DD/YYYY format)
      endDate - the end date of the period to check (in MM/DD/YYYY format)
      x - the number of days in the moving average that is checked if it crosses the other moving average
      y - the number of days in the moving average that is the boundary for the other moving average to cross
      Returns:
      a string listing the positive and negative crossovers. For the View to parse into the final printed output.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if given an invalid ticker symbol

    • chartPerformance

      String chartPerformance​(String portfolioName, String startDate, String endDate)
      Creates a horizontal bar chart of the performance of a portfolio over time. It has bars for regular time intervals from startDate to endDate, and the bar is made up of asterisks, with each asterisk representing the number of dollars indicated in the scale.
      Parameters:
      portfolioName - the portfolio to chart the performance for
      startDate - the beginning of the time period to be included in the graph
      endDate - the end of the time period to be included in the graph
      Returns:
      the final graph as text

    • chartPerformanceStock

      String chartPerformanceStock​(String tickerSymbol, String startDate, String endDate) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Creates a horizontal bar chart of the performance of a stock over time. It has bars for regular time intervals from startDate to endDate, and the bar is made up of asterisks, with each asterisk representing the number of dollars indicated in the scale.
      Parameters:
      tickerSymbol - the stock to chart the performance for
      startDate - the beginning of the time period to be included in the graph
      endDate - the end of the time period to be included in the graph
      Returns:
      the final graph as text
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException
